thread.title: ‘La La Land’ Breaks Golden Globes Record With 7 Prizes
thread.title_full: ‘La La Land’ Breaks Golden Globes Record With 7 Prizes

author: Matt Pressberg
title: ‘La La Land’ Breaks Golden Globes Record With 7 Prizes
text:
Search ‘La La Land’ Breaks Golden Globes Record With 7 Prizes 
Best Picture – Musical or Comedy Winner passes “One Flew Over the Cuckoo’s Nest” and “Midnight Express” with clean sweep Matt Pressberg | January 8, 2017 @ 7:34 PM Lionsgate 
“La La Land” has just set the Globes’ all-time record, as Lionsgate’s musical love note to the City of Angels claimed seven of seven trophies with its win for Best Motion Picture – Musical or Comedy. 
“La La Land” claimed hardware in every other category for which it was nominated earlier in the evening: Best Actor in a Motion Picture – Musical or Comedy (Ryan Gosling), Best Actress in a Motion Picture – Musical or Comedy (Emma Stone), Best Director (Damien Chazelle), Best Screenplay (Chazelle), Best Original Score (Justin Hurwitz) and Best Original Song (Hurwitz et al for “City of Stars.”) 
Chazelle’s musical entered Sunday night as a heavy favorite in almost every category it was nominated in, earning the highest number of nomination for any film this year. 
The Golden Globes show itself opened with a tribute set to a medley of the film’s musical numbers, featuring host Jimmy Fallon, Justin Timberlake, Tina Fey and friends. Also Read: Ryan Gosling Gives Rare Glimpse Into Personal Life in Golden Globes Acceptance Speech (Video) 
The “La La Land” awards sweep is a stunning achievement considering the Hollywood Foreign Press Association’s usual reluctance to give a single film such a concentration of trophies. 
“The Social Network,” which came out in 2009, was the last film to win more than three Globes, and the previous all-time record of six, since topped by “La La Land,” hadn’t been reached since 1978. That year, “Midnight Express” won six awards, three years after “One Flew Over the Cuckoo’s Nest” first achieved that feat. Golden Globes: 25 Red Carpet Looks Ranked From Best to Worst (Photos) 
There were bold and bright choices and also some train wrecks. Getty Images 
1. Yas to Janelle Monae. Only this "Hidden Figures" and "Moonlight" star could pull off something this bold and beautiful. Getty Images 
2. Issa Rae is working it in a floor length white gown. It's so chic. Getty Images 
3. Kristen Bell is stunning in this full length black sequin gown with an on-trend plunging neckline. Getty Images 
4. Evan Rachel Wood took a leap of faith with this pant-suit -- and nailed it. Getty Images 
5. Olivia Culpo's artsy gown worked in her favor. Getty Images 
6. Tracee Ellis-Ross is glowing in this silver sequined gown. Getty Images 
7. This is how you rock a yellow gown. Reese Witherspoon is flawless. FLAWLESS. Getty Images 
8. In a brown velvet suit, Donald Glover stands out among a sea of black tuxes. Getty Images 
9. Mandy Moore is Elvira chic in an all black, low cut gown. She was smart to do a nude lip otherwise it'd be too kitschy. Getty Images 
10. At 67, Judith Light's still got it. Getty Images 
11. Maisie Williams kept it simple and classy with this pretty yellow gown. Getty Images 
12. The top part of Jessica Biel's dress is exquisite, but the bottom portion is odd. Getty Images 
13. Ryan Gosling stands out in his white-on-black tux, but he also resembles a waiter. Getty Images 
14. Meh. Getty Images 
15. Sure, black is on trend, but Amara Karan's gown is swallowing her into a black hole. Getty Images 
16. Michael Shannon needed more time with his tailor. His tux is too small. Getty Images 
17. Brie Larson is clashing her eras. She's wearing the dress of a 1980's Texas beauty queen while her hair is a blast from the 1950s. Getty Images 
18. We don't know what Jessica Chastain was thinking with this blue dress featuring flowery sequins. Getty Images 
19. Natalie Portman is still stuck in her "Jackie" role in this 1960s avocado yellow frock. Getty Images 
20. Kerry Washington let us down with this awkward length, gold patterned dress and she usually never disappoints. At least her makeup is on point. Getty Images 
21. Karrueche's fuchsia prom-gown look is detracting from her natural beauty. Getty Images 
22. It looks like Zoe Saldana got caught in a fight with a cotton candy lace fabric machine... and lost. Getty Images 
23. We love that Pharrell Williams always tries to make a statement but his beanie totally clashes with his suit. It's not even beanie weather. Also, Helen Lasichanh's bo-ho dress doesn't fit the theme. Getty Images 
24. 1980s cocaine chic? Sophie Turner looks like she stepped out of the "Billionaire Boys Club" or "Less Than Zero." Getty Images 
25. Emily Ratajkowski needed more time with her double-sided tape. Under-boob is a tacky look for any red carpet. Getty Images
